thread.title: Delta APC seeks probe of alleged missing N48.6bn accrued to DESOPADEC from May 2015
thread.title_full: Delta APC seeks probe of alleged missing N48.6bn accrued to DESOPADEC from May 2015

author: Okogba
title: Delta APC seeks probe of alleged missing N48.6bn accrued to DESOPADEC from May 2015

organizations.name: delta state oil producing areas development commission

text:
Breaking News Translate Home » News » Delta APC seeks probe of alleged missing N48.6bn accrued to DESOPADEC from May 2015 Delta APC seeks probe of alleged missing N48.6bn accrued to DESOPADEC from May 2015 On 3:24 am In News by Okogba Comments 
A ll Progressives Congress, APC, in Delta State, has called on the state House of Assembly, to probe the issue missing N48.6 billion that had accrued to Delta State Oil Producing Areas Development Commission, DESOPADEC, from May, 2015 to date. 
Embattled state Chairman of the party, Prophet Jones Erue, in a statement, said: “This fund represents 50 per cent of N97.2 billion that had accrued and paid by the Federal Government in respect of 13 per cent derivation funds specifically meant for developing oil-producing areas in Delta State. 
“Speaking through his Chief Press Secretary, the governor declared that the money was deducted to service several financial debts and commitments of the state government.”
